newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Independent indices show Romania OTC market up.
newsitem.headline: Independent indices show Romania OTC market up.

text.p: Romania's over-the-counter (OTC) market gained steam on Tuesday with investors rushing to buy oil refineries, cement makers and metallurgical listings.
Independent indices VAB-RASDAQ and BIG-OTC rose by 7.64 and 9.77 percent respectively from previous session to 4,059.6 and 3,247.56 points and operators predicted further highs.
Traders said buying pressure and relatively low supply had sent the prices of high-caps higher.
"The selling offer increased a little only towards the end of the trading day," one trader said.
Cement makers and oil refineries were the main gainers, with Moldocim closing 10,000 lei firmer at 52,500 and Romcim gaining 5,000 lei to close at 61,000.
Oil refinery Arpechim closed 1,500 lei higher at 46,500.
The RASDAQ volume slid to 2.08 million shares from over 2.5 million on Monday, while turnover went up to 12.9 billion lei from over 12.3 billion. ($=7,092 lei)
